ai_summary: Today's key developments: **AI regulation** continues to dominate headlines as the EU finalises enforcement timelines. In **tech**, Apple quietly updated its developer tooling and GitHub shipped a major Copilot overhaul. Your tracked RSS feeds surfaced two high-signal long-reads on distributed systems worth bookmarking. On **X**, the accounts you follow are discussing the latest OpenAI drama and a viral thread on productivity systems.

articles.title: EU regulators finalise AI Act enforcement timeline for foundation models
articles.summary: European regulators confirmed that providers of general-purpose AI models must comply with transparency obligations by August 2026.

articles.title: Apple ships new Xcode AI assistant integrated with on-device models
articles.summary: The update brings context-aware code completion powered entirely by on-device ML, requiring no internet connection.

articles.title: The hidden cost of distributed transactions — a deep dive
articles.summary: Martin Fowler's team revisits two-phase commit trade-offs and proposes a saga-based alternative for modern microservices.

articles.title: How I read 100 papers a year without burning out
articles.summary: A practical system using progressive summarisation and spaced repetition to stay on top of ML research.

articles.title: @karpathy — Thread: Why I think test-time compute scaling is the most underrated trend in AI right now
articles.summary: Karpathy argues that inference-time scaling will matter more than parameter count in 2026 and beyond.
